original:
Under the leadership of Robert Harris, the Royal Canadian Academy of Arts (RCA) actively promoted Canadian artists in international exhibitions, notably participating in the Canadian Exhibition at the Louisiana Purchase Exposition in 1904. 


The Canadian Art Club, established in 1907 and operational until 1915, aimed to enhance the quality of standard exhibitions. Founded by painters Edmund Morris and Curtis Williamson, the Club sought
sampled:
Under the leadership through Robert Harris, the Royal Canadian Academy in Arts (RCA) actively promoted Canadian artists in international exhibitions, notably participating in the Canadian Exhibition at the Louisiana Purchase Exposition in 1904. 


The Canadian Art Club, established in 1907 and operational until 1915, aimed to enhance the quality of standard exhibitions. Founded by painters Edmund Morris and Curtis Williamson, the Club sought
